result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher E. Waggoner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Same conditions as for probation
ANY UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE STILL TO BE COLLECTED.

supervisions.notes: ***JOC IS AMENDED TO SHOW  -  CONSECUTIVE TO SHEBOYGAN CASE 98CF163 AND KENOSHA CASE 11CF555***

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $405.00   plus surcharges - READ-IN FROM 16CF473.    
*Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel II.  The DE plead guilty, found guilty.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing 7/12/17 @ 1:30.  Bond revoked.  The victim from 15CF774 & 16CF473 was in court & requested contact.  The court advises now that the bond is revoked they may have contact.  Clerk D. Smith.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel II who is requesting an adjournment due to additional discovery & restitution issues.  The court will allow one final adjournment.  JPTC 5/1/17 @ 3:30.  The DE is to be writted from Jackson Correctional.  Clerk D. Smith.

Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty William Michel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. has a hearing in Br. 4 on 3/3/17 at 9:30 for SEHR re 11CF555.  JPTC in this file set for 3/3/17 at 10:30, per Judge.  Bond continued.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Atty. William Michel II appeared on behalf of the DE who was not present.  The DE has recently been revoked on 11CF555 & will be scheduled for a hearing in Br. 4.  Further proceeding 2/2/17 @ 1:30.  Clerk D. Smith.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel who was just appointed.  Atty.
